update.description:
Updates the noise models to have dynamic bias as well as update the IMU to use the noise models.

‌

Note that this adds a second argument to the `Noise::Apply` method to pass dt. This is necessary for time-correlated noise. I have given it a default value of 0.0, which means that time-correlated noise won’t be applied unless a sensor correctly passes in dt \(available thru updateRate\).
update.title: [Blueprint] Update IMU Noise Models

content.raw: Looks like everything except Homebrew and Windows.  I believe that the homebrew issues are known.
content.html: Looks like everything except Homebrew and Windows. I believe that the homebrew issues are known.

content.raw:
Nit: Maybe structure bindings are more readable here:

```
for (const auto [unused, sdfNoise] : noises)
```

Up to you, not sure if there’s an easy way to deal with the unused parameter.
content.html:
Nit: Maybe structure bindings are more readable here:

for (const auto [unused, sdfNoise] : noises)

Up to you, not sure if there’s an easy way to deal with the unused parameter.

content.raw:
For reference, these are what the generated Allan Variance plots look like.  They should be compared to the ADIS16448 Datasheet \([https://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/adis16448.pdf](https://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/adis16448.pdf)\)\(Page 9\).

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/da5rgr4/images/644162961-accel_allan.png)
content.html: For reference, these are what the generated Allan Variance plots look like. They should be compared to the ADIS16448 Datasheet (https://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/adis16448.pdf)(Page 9).

content.raw: Yes, I debated retargeting it, but it seemed like less work to merge it in here.  I think most parties were notified.
content.html: Yes, I debated retargeting it, but it seemed like less work to merge it in here. I think most parties were notified.

content.html: FYI: The Lidar code has been reviewed in another PR. Don't let that stop you from giving it a second pass though.
